info.abstract:
[Type] Data Process.
[Behaviour] It moves a cube to another folder.
[Parameters] - cube : target cube. - path : destination path, which can be relative to the cwd or absolute. - cwd : absolute path corresponding to the current working directory. The user can operate only within his folders/containers.
[System parameters] - exec_mode : operator execution mode. Possible values are async (default) for asynchronous mode, sync for synchronous mode with json-compliant output. - ncores : number of parallel processes to be used (min. 1). This operator is not parallel, so the only possible value is 1. - sessionid : session identifier used server-side to manage sessions and jobs. Usually users don't need to use/modify it, except when it is necessary to create a new session or switch to another one. - objkey_filter : filter on the output of the operator written to file (default=all => no filter, none => no output). movecontainer : no output.
[Examples] Move the datacube identified by the PID "http://www.example.com/1/1" to folder "newfolder" OPH_TERM: oph_movecube cube=http://www.example.com/1/1;path=newfolder;cwd=/session-code1; SUBMISSION STRING: "operator=oph_movecube;cube=http://www.example.com/1/1;path=newfolder;cwd=/session-code1;"
